task_summary: Detect bread, grasp it, move above the plate, place it on the plate, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2-style manipulator must pick a piece of bread from the right side of a tabletop and place it onto a small white plate positioned to the left on a green mat. The robot first perceives the bread, approaches from above with a pinch grasp, aligns precisely, and performs a pick. With the bread secured, it transfers above the plate, gently lowers until contact, releases the bread on the plate, and retreats. The scene includes a plate, bread, and a flat workspace; careful positioning and gentle placement are important.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for a plate and a bread piece
Camera provides sufficient view of bread and plate
Plate is stable on the mat
stepwise_plan: Move above bread and compute grasp pose
Align and pick bread with a pinch grasp
success_criteria: Bread ends resting on the plate surface
failure_and_recovery: Bread not detected -> rescan area with raster pattern
Failed grasp -> recompute grasp and retry
Early contact when placing -> retreat slightly and reattempt lowering
Bread dropped in transit -> re-detect and re-pick if visible
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the bread is released on the plate and the arm has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_7.now_evidence: Bread is on the plate with gripper above, indicating the release phase.
frame_7.predicts_next: Robot will retreat to complete the task.

node_specs.description: Open gripper to maximum allowed width before grasp and to release when placing.
Detect target object (bread first, then plate).
Move to a pre-place/pre-grasp pose above the target with vertical clearance.
Compute pinch grasp for bread and store pose key.
Refine alignment before grasping with tight tolerance.
Execute grasp using precomputed grasp pose.
Check that the grasp is stable before transfer.
Lower bread until gentle contact with the plate is detected.
Retreat to a safe height after placement.

recovery_strategy: Re-run detection with raster scan pattern
If dropped and visible, re-detect and re-pick
Abort if repeated failures exceed safe limit
assumptions: Although the instruction says 'picking a bread', frames clearly show a pick-and-place onto a plate. The BT follows the frames and includes placement and retreat steps.
